if you do and more here how to breastfeed here are common issues and how to troubleshoot fix them this is what normal and here are some common myths dispelled and they would be guilted into breastfeeding out of fear of judgement or that their child would be unhealthy if he she ate formula there would be significantly better treatment of women post partum instead of asking them to be back to normal basically right after birth thanks for sharing was told from the day my son was born that exclusively breastfeeding would not be easy possible for me it was even something thought about while pregnant figured if could great if not that okay everything changed once my son was born felt like did get choice they threw nipple shield at me lactation consultants paraded in and out of my recovery room and were poking at me and my son for days ultimately he never latched and have been exclusively pumping and supplementing once day my son is happy and healthy at months but struggle with feeling like good mom whenever have to supplement it is so hard to find peace with decisions we have to make or want to for that matter and am tired of having to justify formula when am trying my hardest including waking up at 3am every night to pump when my son has slept through the night for weeks gt parents on the christian right might see breast feeding as sign of the rightness of awful hand picking research that supports your cause claiming that breastfeeding accessories are big business as much as formula boohooing about poor women not getting wic as long if they breastfeed when formula is in fact provided this article is just ridiculous ll tell you the truths about breastfeeding and they are not in this article breastfeeding is better for both mom and baby almost every woman can breastfeed with the right information and support which many do have there is ton of misinformation about breastfeeding in america and it causes lot of failure it would be better for breastfeeding if women in america got longer maternity leave the rest of this article is garbage my daughter never latched properly pumped exclusively for months and then supplemented my milk with formula as she was eating more than could pump at months had to have surgery that had long recovery time and would allow me to pump anymore so at that point my daughter went fully on formula it more important that mother be healthy and sane to take care of her child than for that child to be exclusively breastfed if we really cared about breastfeeding the hospitals and doctors would be much more supportive in helping new parents learn how to do it and be successful many maternity wards just are set up to properly launch breastfeeding it all well and good to guilt mother into feeling bad about breastfeeding when you have actually provided her with the tools and the time to actually do it you have good point had my son on saturday and he was in the nicu for months the lactation consultant was there monday through friday during business hours learned how to pump from busy nurses the consultant finally visited me the day was going home also went back to work right away so would visit my son evening and weekends there was never lactation consultant available during those times thank goodness for the wonderful nicu nurses who helped me get everything figured out while everything worked out ca say the lactation consultant had much to do with the success have four children the one that nursed the longest has the worst health of all of them by wide margin the one that nursed the shortest is the most artistic the one that nursed the second longest is probably the smartest however you want to measure that the one that nursed the second shortest is the most compassionate breastfeeding is great but in the end the things that are going to give your child the best outcomes are financial and social stability agreed women need less pressure to breastfeed and more actual support and help laws that support them to breastfeed their children allowing them to stay home longer nurse in public etc better educated doctors and lactation consultants etc the misinformation and lack of societal support are such big issues am lucky to be home with my 10 month old son but if had to return to job at weeks like so many american women would be shocked if we were still breastfeeding and the misinformation unfortunately comes from trusted sources like our doctors if listened to my son pediatrician would have started spacing his feeds at month old and who knows if we still be breastfeeding after that it makes me sad to think there are woman who wanted to breastfeed and did get to because they were told wrong information or could make it work with their work schedule at the hospital was pretty much only shown how to latch my baby so many common questions and myths could be addressed in simple pamphlet do understand why they do have something like that it would have saved me so much worrying even if someone had just said to me it totally normal for your baby to want to nurse ton sometimes but instead was told do feed him too often or he ll learn bad habits seriously even with all my preparation and reading had no idea what thrush was when got it so spent all this time trying to fix baby latch thinking that was causing my pain obviously that did nothing and the pain got worse there is so much focus on getting good latch which is important but really wish they gave out broader information on breastfeeding that unfortunate while believe that every woman should at least try to breastfeed as long as health issues are not present no one should feel bad about their decisions my goal is to give as much info as possible so that families can make as an informed decision as possible unfortunately still struggle with those that choose to not even try but that is my issue that need to over come think my biggest problem is do think people do their research plus they get bad advice from authority figures they trust so sorry you feel like less of mother because you obviously greatly care about your child and are trying so hard that ridiculous and assume that lot of people ca afford to hire private consultant or there is one upvote upvote upvote all for breast feeding however am completely appalled by what perceive as shaming some women make the conscious decision to formula feed and that is their right while others medically and or situationally have no choice educating women and lobbying for better family leave is one thing but the current campaign is downright hurtful when you are mom just trying to do your best formula is not baby junk food not debating the differences but let not exaggerate them babies live and with me although breastfeeding is undoubtedly better for the baby agree with this article too it pushed bit too much thought it would be easy to breastfeed my baby too it fucking not it pretty hard eventually quit at about months because it was taking sooo much time between pumping and actual feedings it was also making me exhausted and no was anemic because if you want to take nap while helper cares for the baby you are exhausted you have to pump milk for the kid in advance well then your boobs are little off because by the time baby is hungry next you will likely be little overfull this can then pace your production wrong so unless you are there all the time your production can be off nipple confusion can also be an issue if you use bottle for feeding sometimes too eventually my baby boycotted my nipples so had to pump all the time it felt like my entire life revolved around pumping my life got instantly easier when we switched to formula at months there are good things about it do get me wrong the health benefits feeling close and of course helping with weight loss after birth if our society was structured differently it might be lot easier for women to breastfeed too
